vignette.name: The Patch Cord Menu
vignette.bodytext: The Patch Cord Contextual Menu makes your patching life easier by providing you quick access to a number of useful patching activities with a click of the mouse. You can use the menu to quickly align, delete and route connections, create or delete watchpoints when debugging a patch, and even disable/enable a selected connection.

bluebox.header2: Viewing the Patch Cord Contextual Menu

ul.li: Hover over a patchcord to highlight it and display the menu button, and click on the menu button to display the contextual menu.

vignette.bodytext: The Patch Cord Contextual Menu displays

ul.li: Menu items that let you delete, align, and route a patch cord or remove its segments.
Menu items that let you add or remove Monitor or Break watchpoints to the connection, and show/hide the watchpoint.
Menu items for enabling and disabling the patch cord connection.
A menu item to set the color of the patch cord.

bluebox.header2: Getting information from the Patch Cord Contextual Menu

ul.li: Hover over a patchcord to highlight it and display the menu button, and click on the menu button to display the contextual menu.
As you move your cursor over any menu listings, a description of the message will appear in the Patcher window's Status Bar.

bluebox.header2: Patching from the Patch Cord Contextual Menu

ul.li: Choose Delete from the menu to delete the currently selected patch cord.
Choose Align from the menu to align the currently selected patch cord.
Choose Route Patch Cords from the menu to create a patch cord path that routes the connection to avoid overlapping external objects in your patch.
Choose Remove All Segments from the menu to remove any and all segments in the selected patch cord.
Choose Color.... from the menu to open the Color Picker and choose a color for the currently selected patch cord.

bluebox.header2: Debugging with the Patch Cord Contextual Menu

ul.li: Choose Add Watchpoint - Monitor from the menu to add a monitor watchpoint to the currently selected patch cord.
Choose Add Watchpoint - Break from the menu to add a monitor watchpoint to the currently selected patch cord.
Choose Remove Watchpoint from the menu to remove any breakpoints associated with the currently selected patch cord.
Choose Show Watchpoints from the menu to display the Watchpoints Window

bluebox.bodytext: You can use the Patch Cord Contextual menu to disable a patch cord - to prevent it from sending data to the object to which it is connected.

ul.li: Hover over a patchcord to highlight it and display the menu button, and click on the menu button to display the contextual menu.
Choose Disable Patch Cord from the contextual menu. The patch cord will be greyed out and display a button indicating that it is disabled.

bluebox.bodytext: Choose Enable Patch Cord from the contextual menu to re-enable data transfer.
